intro: Erigeron bonjeani, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its fluffy, blue-gray flower heads that resemble a misty cloud, blooming in late summer and early fall. The plant has silvery-green leaves with a fuzzy texture, and it grows in a variety of habitats including meadows, woodlands, and disturbed areas. It is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Erigeron bonjeani is a perennial herb that prefers full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil.
